page.title: 04Ecology - S.S.S.I.
page.content: Crosemere, Sweatmere and Colemere are designated Sites of Special Scientific Interest. (Colemere is dealt with fully elsewhere.) There is no management agreement but the N.C.C> take a keen interest. Sweatmere is inaccessible, fringed with reedbeds and marshy woodland; there is about l acre of open water, but this is reducing through natural reedbed invasion. Crosemere has a generally open shore, with a l00yd fringe of form or woodland unimproved. Reed warblers nest in dense reedbeds and a flock of canada geese is resident. Plants around Crosemere include- Celery-leaved Buttercup, Monkeyflower, Common Valerian, Reed, Softrush, Knapweed, Yellow Loosestrife, Tufted Vetch, Meadow Vetchling, Marsh Pennywort, Common Spotted Orchid. Alder thickets are also present.
